metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15927 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.20.2. An out-of-bounds access exists in the function build_audio_procunit in the file sound/usb/mixer.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1039-aws - 4.4.0-1039.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-143-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-143-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1039.42').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-143.169~14.04.2').
